p: On presentation the patient was febrile, tachycardic, and tachypneic, requiring 3 L oxygen (O 2) via nasal canula. On examination she appeared anorexic, pale, and dehydrated. Cardiac auscultation revealed a 3/6 holosystolic murmur loudest at the left lower sternal border. Bilateral fine crackles were appreciated on auscultation of the lower lung fields. Laboratory data showed as in Table 1: white cell countÂ 16.8 x 10 9/L with 81% neutrophils, hemoglobin 6.0 g/dL, hematocrit 19.2%, platelets 47 x 10 9/L, prothrombin time 13.2 sec, fibrinogen 498 mg/dL, D-dimer of 12.9 mg/L, and lactic acid 6.0 mmol/L.
